page.title: 01 Willowbog to Hobb's Flow
page.content: The Kielder Forest covers at least 90% of the area of this D-Block.With the tree-covered slopes rising westward to the border between England and Scotland, the forest is broken only by a small area of open moorland on the Scottish side. Water drains to the east by means of th{Neate Burn},{ {Grains Burn}and{Buck Burn,}and to the west by{Clark's Sike.} An area of bog known as{Hobb's Flow}is to be found betwen the forest and the open moorland. The only settlement in the area is a small-holding called{Willowbog.}This is now owned by a Scout Group from Tyneside. It is typical of the cottages more normally found in ruins in the depths of the dense forest. A footpath follows the route of a drovers'/pack road towards the border. { }
